edu.ucla.sspace.nonlinear
Class LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.common.GenericTermDocumentVectorSpace
      edu.ucla.sspace.nonlinear.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis
All Implemented Interfaces:
SemanticSpace
public class LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis
extends GenericTermDocumentVectorSpace

An implementation of Locality Preserving Semantic Analysis (LPSA). LPSA is a non-linear reduction of the Vector Space Model (VSM) through use of Locality Preserving Projections (LPP). In this sense, LPSA is related to LSA, but uses a different reduction of the VSM for the final word representations. This implementation is based on the following paper.

  • forthcoming

This class offers configurable preprocessing and dimensionality reduction. through two parameters.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.transform"
Default: none.
This variable sets the preprocessing algorithm to use on the term-document matrix prior to computing the SVD. The property value should be the fully qualified named of a class that implements Transform. The class should be public, not abstract, and should provide a public no-arg constructor.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.dimensions"
Default: 300
The number of dimensions to use for the semantic space. This value is used as input to the SVD.

Furthermore, this class offer four configurable parameters for impacting how LPP is applied to the VSM.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.affinityEdgeType"
Default: EdgeType.NEAREST_NEIGHBORS.
This property sets the how the affinity matrix is constructed from the initial vector space. The default behavior is to use the 20 nearest neighbors. See AffinityMatrixCreator.EdgeType for details.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.affinityEdgeTypeParam"
Default: 20
The property sets an optional parameter to the AffinityMatrixCreator.EdgeType selection. The interpretation of this parameter is specific to the type of edge used.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.affinityEdgeWeighting"
Default: EdgeWeighting.COSINE_SIMILARITY.
This property sets the type of weighting to use for words that are connected in the affinity matrix. The default behavior is to use the cosine similarity of the words in the original VSM. See AffinityMatrixCreator.EdgeWeighting for other options.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.lpsa.LocalityPreservingSemanticAnalysis.affinityEdgeWeightingParam"
Default: 0
This property sets an optional parameters to the edge weighting mechanism. In the default cosine similarity edge weighting, this parameter is unused. See See AffinityMatrixCreator.EdgeWeighting for details on other options' usage of this parameter.

This class is thread-safe for concurrent calls of processDocument. Once processSpace has been called, no further calls to processDocument should be made. This implementation does not support access to the semantic vectors until after processSpace has been called.

Author:
David Jurgens
See Also:
Transform, LocalityPreservingProjection, GenericTermDocumentVectorSpace, LSA

Method Detail

getSpaceName

public String getSpaceName()
Returns a unique string describing the name and configuration of this algorithm. Any configurable parameters that would affect the resulting semantic space should be expressed as a part of this name.

processSpace

public void processSpace(Properties properties)
Once all the documents have been processed, performs any post-processing steps on the data. An algorithm should treat this as a no-op if no post-processing is required. Callers may specify the values for any exposed parameters using the properties argument.

By general contract, once this method has been called, processDocument will not be called again.

Parameters:
properties - a set of properties and values that may be used to configure any exposed parameters of the algorithm. See this class's javadoc for the full list of supported properties.
